Configure a GSM Profile for Access Nodes

Use this task to configure a Global System for Mobile communications (GSM) profile for a Converged Wireless System (CWS) access node which performs as a multi-carrier node that can operate as a standalone base station or Remote-Radio Head (RRH) connected to a virtualized Baseband Unit (vBBU)

  1. In the navigation bar, click Profiles > Summary.
  2. In the Profiles window, click the System Profiles tab.
  3. Click +Create.
  4. In the Create System Profile window, enter the name of this profile in the Profile Name field.
  5. Select GsmConfig from the Profile Type drop-down list and enter the name of the CWS access node (64 characters or less) for which GSM parameters are set in the CWS Name field below.
  6. Click GSM Cell Data and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    Cell ID field Enter the GSM cell ID from 0 to 60.
    LAC field

    Enter the Location Area Code from 0 to 60.
  7. Click BS ID to configure Base Station Identifier (ID) parameters by completing the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    NCC field Enter the Network Color Code (NCC) number from 0 to 7 for the GERAN cell node.
    BCC field

    Enter the GERAN Base Station (BTS) Color Code Number (BCC) from 0 to 7.
  8. Complete the next two fields:

    Field

    Description
    VBSC Address field Enter IPv4 address for the virtual Base Station Controller (BSC) subscriber sessions.
    VBSC Port field

    Select the VBSC port number.
  9. Click PLMN to configure the following parameters for the Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) wireless communications system:

    Field

    Description
    MCC field Specify the Mobile Country Code (MCC) three-digit identifier from 001 to 999 for the Home Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) zone to which this GSM cell belongs.
    MNC field

    Specify the Mobile Network Code (MNC) three-digit identifier from 001 to 999 for a foreign PLMN to which this GSM cell belongs.
    Home checkbox Check the Checkbox for the selection of the primary Home PLMN first.
  10. Click Radio Carier to specify one or more radio carrier instances for this profile. Click the plus button (+) to add more instances. The following parameters can be configured for each instance:

    Field

    Description
    IsBCCHPrimary checkbox Check the checkbox to designate that the Broadcast Common Control Channel (BCCH), which transmits on a fixed frequency to make proper receive level measurements for neighbor cell UEs, is based on the recommendation in GSM 05.08 and is used as the primary channel.
    Arfcn field

    Make the following entry to identify the downlink Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (ARFCN) from 0 to 60.
    TxPower checkbox

    Enter the ARFCN transmit power from 1 to 46 dBM. The default is 46 dBM

    The following TRX power rules are used for a single and multiple antenna port scenarios:

    Single TRX - A maximum trx-power of 46 dBm (40 W) can be configured.

    Two TRX:

    • If each TRX is configured on a different antenna, then a maximum trx-power of 46 dBm (40 W) can be configured. This results in 80 W of total power.
    • If both TRX are configured with the same antenna, a maximum trx-power of 43 dBm (20 W) can be configured.

    Three TRX:

    • If all TRX are configured with the same antenna, a maximum trx-power of 41 dBm (12 W) can be configured.
    • With two TRX on one antenna and one TRX in another antenna, a maximum trx-power of 41 dBm (12 W) can be configured.

    Four TRX - A maximum trx-power of 40 dBm (10 W) can be configured.

    In cases where a GSM cell is configured for 2G +3G or 2G+4G RAT combinations, consider the following points for calculating the TRX power to be configured:

    • Get the remaining power (in dBm) that can be allocated to 2G trans-mission for each antenna.
    • Out of the remaining TRX power per antenna, calculate the maximum trx-power in dBm as:
      • Single TRX: Remaining power
      • Two TRX: Remaining power minus 3
      • Three TRX: Remaining power minus 5
      • Four TRX: Remaining power minus 6
  11. Click Codec to specify the number of codec types that are used on the GSM cell network from 0 to 60 codecs that are allowed for each radio carrier instance for this profile. Click the plus button (+) to add another codec value for another radio carrier instance.
  12. Click Create+.
Parent topic: Configure Device System Profiles
